verb.description: Wash or rinse out (an area or container) by pouring large amounts of water or other liquid over or into it.
Drink (something) greedily or in large quantities.
examples: they whiled away their evening swilling pints of beer

noun.description: Kitchen refuse and scraps of waste food mixed with water for feeding to pigs.
A large mouthful of a drink.

origin: Old English swillan, swilian (verb), of unknown origin. The noun dates from the mid 16th century.
